text: Bottle from notes. Pours a dark cola brown color with a small beige head. The aroma and flavor have moderately roasted malt, cocoa, hint of black coffee, dark fruit, thin, just ok.

12 oz bottle. From demolenbeershop.com.
Black color with a small tan head. 
Vanilla, sweetness, mild sourness, dryness and roasted maltiness in the aroma. The flavor is roasted malt, vanilla, sweetness, mild coffee and some sourness. I dont know how old this is but it doesnt taste that fresh. Maybe a rerate sometime.

Bottle shared at King William IV - London. Pours black-brown with a foamy off-white head. Seems a bit infected. Lightly roasty on the nose. Lightly sweet, tangy, with nips of cocoa and toffee. Light bodied with average to lively carbonation. Sweet and somewhat tangy on the finish, some berries, cocoa. So so.

Aromas dominated by malts; hops are very mild; fairly pronounced caramel aromas.

Fairly light bodied;medium sweetness; quite light bitter.

Slightly creamy texture; average carbonation; finish is sweet and malty.

Overall an ok but not very distinguished beer.
Pours a jet black with a long-lasting off-white foam head. Aroma is lots of roast and caramel. Flavor is roast and sweet caramel. Has lots of flavor. This is very enjoyable.

Pours very black with a tall cappuccino head that settles to a thick ring and leaves some spotty ropes of lace. Nose involves earthy and herbal hop notes, some dark fruit, toasted malt, mint, and savory spice. Fairly sweet, decently bitter. Medium bodied, fairly active, oily and coating, with a drying toasty finish. Very nice brew, a style that probably doesnt get enough love but this shows that, done well, theyre very enjoyable, complex and drinkable at the same time.
Oh this is delicious. Smells like a pub in England . Nice thin creamy head. Maltiniceness.

Bottle. Black pour with a small foamy head that fades to a messy ring. Aromas are burnt marshmallows, some char, light chocolate, and toasted grains. Taste like burnt bread, marshmallow, charred wood, and light cocoa. Medium body. Really nice schwarz.

dark brown color. Light brown color. Treacles an 
chocolate malt. Very rich flavorful and rounded. A touch acidic.
12 ounce bottle. Thanks Brandon. Pours dark brown with a decent tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, and coffee. Taste is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, dark grain, and caramel. Very good.

Pout from a 12oz bottle. Deep dark reddish brew with tan head. Aroma of roasted grain, coffee - very stoutish. Taste is deeply roasted grains with coffee overtones _ I expect it to get heavier as the swallow continues but it gets lighter and more agile while still delivering a great complex malty roasted grain taste. Most schwarzbeirs that I have tried ahve been somewhat enhanced lagers but this one really rocks.

Smell is almost stout like very good caramel cocoa, deep dark beer with a reddish brown tinge, flavor has character everything from chocolate coffee caramel to, earthy and alcohol (not to much just right) really like this beer, the lager like approach turned to really work for this beer will buy again good job shorts

12 ounce bottle into lager glass, bottled on 2/2/2015. Pours slightly hazy very dark brown color with a 1 finger dense tan head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the head. Aromas of big dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, caramel, toast, dark bread, light smoke/char, herbal, and roast/smoke earthiness. Damn nice aromas with good complexity of dark/roasted malt and earthy hop notes; with good strength. Taste of big dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, caramel, toast, dark bread, light smoke/char, herbal, and roast/smoke earthiness. Fair amount of herbal hop and roast bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, toast, dark bread, light smoke/char, and roasted earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roasted malt and earthy hop flavors; with a great roasted bitterness/sweetness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Very clean in lager flavors with zero yeast notes present. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, crisp, fairly creamy, and slightly sticky/chalky mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent schwarzbier style. All around great robustness, complexity, and balance of dark/roasted malt and earthy hop flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink. A very enjoyable offering.
Pours black with a tan head. Aromas of coffee and chocolate. Flavors are similar.
Bottle thanks to Brian. Pours a cloudy brown with no head. The aroma is roast and caramel. Thin mouth with strong caramel and light roast. Good.
Botella de 33 cl en el lúpulo en julio de 2012. color oscuro casi negro. Cuerpo medio fácil de beber y con toques maltosos y cereales ligeramente tostados. Buena, se puede repetir.

Bona cervesa, bastant equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, bastante equilibrada y sabrosa.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein sehr dunkelbraunes Bier mit beiger Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr röstmalzig, Schokolade. Geschmack röstmalzig, trocken schokoladig, Kaffee, leicht bitter, minimal süßer Abgang.
light chocolate aroma,black, brown foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, oily feel, soft carbonation, light dry chocolate and caramel finish.
Dark, almost black. Has a light brown head. Roasted aroma with notes of cerials. Flavor starts light sweet, roasted, light chocolate, dry chocolate. Moderate bitter finish.

$3 on-tap during Happy Hour at HopCat.

Appearance: Welp, its black. What did you expect? Decent lacing, nothing special.

Smell: Ash. Smoke. Chocolate.

Taste/feel: Like the smell... tastes like ground up bricks, soil, smokey ash, roastiness, and a bit of chocolate. That should sound disturbing -- and it was disturbing to my dad and sister -- but its what I thought the beer would taste like, and I enjoyed it. The smoke/ash flavor isnt massive, but its definitely there, and the chocolate/coffee flavors follow. The feel is a bit thin for my liking, but it does make this a very drinkable beer.

Another tasty brew from Shorts. Im not too sure I like this more than their Black Diamond, which is a pretty similar beer, but its still one that Id like to have again when I want a dark beer thats not quite a stout or a porter.

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2017 Aroma is nice, light roasted malt, roasted nuts maybe. Appearance is not quite black, more like dark brown. Taste is solid, like a good porter, roasted malt and a touch of something sweet. Cant put my finger on that. Mouthfeel is perfect, super thick. Overall it is pretty great, good work Shorts.

Bottle split in the beer garden at King William IV on the Rainbow IPA day, sourced from a bin end sale at the Cask, 21/09/13.
Light black with a good sized off white head.
Nose is dark malts, toffee, dark fruit notes.
Taste follows, light cocoa, a touch lactic.
Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, dry finish.
Mediocre.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 03.10.2013, 0,35l bottle @ home:
Big brown-ish longlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet and rich, dark malts, dark sugar, licorice, dark fruits, burnt caramel, grass. Taste is kind of sour-ish dry, dark malts, grass, sour coffee, sour unripe berries, burnt caramel and ashtray. Medium bitterness, veru thin sour-ish mouthfeel. Bad bottle??
Aroma: sweet caramel and roasted malt. App: black with thin tan head. Taste: good mix of bitter chocolate with sweet tones. Palate: full with a long finish. Overall: very good.
Bottle from Cask Pub & Kitchen and drunk at home. Black beer lasting beige head. Its a toasty roasty chocolate type beer. Its half decent, quite drinkable and I like it.
Bottle @ GBF 2013. Dark reddish brown with a small tan head. malty and fruity tones. Malt, fruit, roasted and bitterness. Medium body with a bitter / sour finish.
Draft @ beer exchange, pours a dark brown. Flavor is dark roasted malt and chocolate. Easy drinkin.

Bottled, large sample. Dark brown color, medium frothy brown head. Aroma of chocolate, roast, caramel, earthy and grassy hop. Lots of roast and quite high on bitterness in taste. Fairly dry. High on aroma and taste, but finish is a bit watery and dry, which is actually the only thing that lacks in the beer. Great stuff.

On tap at the brewpub. Black pour with a brown head. Aroma of roasted aromas, chocolate, coffee, licorice, vanilla. The taste is malty with roasted grains, burnt and dark bitter chocolate. Smooth creamy finish with a hint of raisin. Joe knows Schwarzbier!
Bottle from trade. Pours black with light Brown head. Aroma is bourbon. Taste is lots of vanilla and bourbon. Flavor fades

355 ml bottle shared at a loco tasting. Coca cola colored body with a tan colored rim. Roasted raisins and Bret notes on the nose. Roasted coffee and cellar notes added in the mouth. Medium bodied and smooth. Dry tongue.

Shared bottle at local tasting. Pours almost pitch black with no head at all. Aroma of dark malts, light roasted, tobacco and coffee. Taste is light roasted, well balanced with hops, easy to like this schwarz. Smooth mouthfeel.

Shared 355 ml bottle, thanks to abemorsten. Black colour, moderate beige head. Lovely complex aroma, roasty and oaky notes, coffee and chocolate, hints of cigar tobacco, leather and dark dried fruits. Smooth flavour, medium dry, coffee and wood. Too moderate hops, but still a very enjoyable beer.

Flaske hos Ole Anders mai-13: fin aroma av røstet malt. Kort skum. Syrlig rugsmak, i tillegg til tobakk og mørke bær. God, men med en viss reservasjon. I litt større mengde en smaking vil den nok gi sustenance.

Bottle shared thanks to Dmac. Pours black with a small off white head. Aroma is of chocolate, light bitter hops, cream, roast. Taste is complex, some dark toast, oak, mild fruity sweetness, chocolate, light lingering bitterness.

Bottle:
Medium sized, vast yet a bit lively, slowly changin beige tan foamy head on top of a very very deep dark ruby to almost black colored beer.
Aromas of mocha, chalk, roast, cacoa, milk chocolate, some hops, hint of coffee (roast), slight hint of charcoal, crushed pepper rounds and other spices. Lot like a milk stout
Flavour has lots of roast, chalk, cacoa, burn, bitters and grass. There is some hints of spices like pepper and bay leaf, chocolate, malts in a toast/roasty way.
Aftertaste chocolate, cocoa, (malty) roast, bitters, light dry and some chalk.
Low carbo, soft lightly blown foamy mouthfeel, medium to fuller body and a creamy texture.
Very stout a like, tasty beer, balanced and going towards a complex beer. Nice.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle at Klooster.  Pours dark brown with a beige head.  Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, coffee and dark fruit.  Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter.  Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

35cl bottle shared at tge klooster
Thin creamy tan head. Clear black pour.  Nice brew.
Bottled. Poured dark amber in color with a tan head. Chocolate, roasted malt and some bitterness in aroma. Chocolate, roasted coffee and perhaps some wood in taste also.

Great big bourbon chocolate roast. Taste is similar with a bit of cherry tartness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Molasses, dark fruit, chocolate aroma. Black brown with a small tan head. Ashy malt, chocolate, fruity flavor with a roasty bitterness. Light to medium body, dry finish.  Finally! A Shorts that didnt have to go down the drain.

On draft at Churchkey in D.C.

The beer is a deep, dark shade of brown with a large beige head that leaves copious lacing on the snifter. 

The aroma is slightly sweet, bready, and lightly roasty. 

The flavor is malt forward with a light roast character. Each sip brings a subtle sweetness, with hints of dark fruit. A decent beer, and one Id try again.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 06-16-2011
Roasted caramel with malted coffee undertones. Pours black with minimal head. Lively mouthfeel with heavy coffee and chocolate maltyness. Slight aftertaste of dry coffee malt. Not at all bad.

Bottle thanks to mibirder.  Black witha  small-medium light brown head.  Aroma is bourbon, caramel, vanilla, coconut; classic bourbon aged beer aroma. Taste is more of the same, medium sweet, with a mild-medium roasted bitterness.  Finish is dry with lingering bourbon.  Soft-moderate carbonation, medium body.  Good stuff.
Bottle. Red dark brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, berries, coffee, malt. Flavour is roasted malt, berries, grain, coffee, malt, caramel, hop. Medium to full body. Nice beer.

Bottle from Brian - thanks!  Black pour with a quickly fading fizzle of a tan head.  Aroma is roast, coffee, chocolate, and a bit of nuts like a brown ale.  Taste has a nice roasted character with chocolate, hop bitterness, and darker raisin notes into the finish.  Airy and coating mouthfeel.  This is a great beer.
very dark brown with one finger tan head. smoke is the main flavor. otherwise a bit like a light porter. pretty dry.

Bottle:  The aroma consists of chocolate, roast, and some dusty notes.  It pours a dark brown with no transparency and a two finger light brown head with decent retention.  The flavor starts with moderate chocolate, light caramel, and a hint of fruit.  The finish has light-moderate roast and some light piney bitterness.  Its medium bodied with moderate carbonation.
Bottle from Skjold Burne. Nice head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are roast malt, chocolate, notes of smoke, caramel and hops.
Bottle 0,355ltr: Black/brown coloured brew with an taste of bitterish chocolate, nice Schwarzbier from Michigan.

Bottle 355ml @ yngwie
Pours clear reddish dark brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes rosted malt, caramel and fruity hops. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a short caramel and bitter finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a nice beige head. Aroma is spicy malt, some burnt notes, hops and fruitiness. Flavor is sweet and malty with some fruitiness, caramel, some sour notes, dark berries, bitterness and hints of peachy hops. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle. A dense, two-finger dark beige head forms over reddish dark brown body. Nice lacings. Roasted, almost burnt aroma with a spiced and hoppy touch. Some dark berries too. Its a bit too carbonated I think, medium to full-bodied and quite smooth. Lightly acidic, with roasted malts, dried fruits and a pleasant bitterness. Lasting finish with raisin notes and a good bitterness that lasts, of both the hoppy and roasted kind. Certainly a nice one, maybe not the most true to style schwarzbier, but good. 120324
Bottle. Frothy off-white good mostly lasting head. Black colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Average moderate finish. Very roasted. Oily palate.

From notes.  First reviewed 9/22/2011.  Poured from a 12 oz. bottle into a tulip. Thanks to Dunt for bringing this over.

Mahogany with transparent edges and a creamy tan cap that fades.

A little bit of bourbon, dark malts, molasses, and some chocolate.

The flavor is a little bit strange. The flavor is light - chocolate, molasses, dark unroasted malt, some bourbon. It finishes kind of watery. 

Somehow this has a creamy feel but a watery body. Boozy in the back of my throat. Sticky.

This is all right at best. In terms of barrel aged beers, it does not stack up well, though.

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2012 Bottled. Pours clear black with a brownish glow and a small tan head. Fair lacing. Nose of roasted malt chocolate and notes of coffee + bourbon. Sweet flavor with chocolate, roasted coffee and bourbon. Medium to full bodied, creamy to oily texture and soft carbonation. Ends up more dry and slightly bitter. Quite complex for a schwartz beer.★★★

33cl bottle from Ölbutikken. More black than brown, lacing beige head. Aroma has light roastedness, light vegetable aroma and some bread. Flavor is roasted malt and lots of caramel. Dry, hoppier finish.

0.33l bottle from Ølbutikken, Copenhagen. Pours a deep brown body with a small quickly fading and bubbly tan head. Light roasted and some sweet chocolate with a faint faint acidic vinegar touch. Average carbonation and it has a somewhat thin and light texture. Yeah, definitely something sour here alright. Thin chocolate, coffee with cocoa hints, is it wild yeast in this one? Licorice in the quite sweet finish and a distinct hoppy bitter aftertaste. It kinda grows a bit on you this one. Started off quite septic, but when I put away all prejudiced thoughts I have when it comes to the schwarzbier genre, its actually quite delicate. 27.01.2012

355ml bottle. Opaque black with medium to huge frothy beige head, collapsing to a thin film. Bitter chocolate aroma, bitter hop accompanied, decent roasty notes. Taste has also dark bitter chocolate, grain, a matallic note, in the course nourished by sweeter chocolate notes.
More like a black alchemical potion than a beer and what a potion. Medicinal anise with other herbal notes. Something to drink while youre working on your philosophers stone...
user_location: Peoples Republic of Bloomington, Indiana, USA

text:
Bottle.  Not bad.  Black pour with medium head and no retention.  Nose is malty with maybe a hint of licorice and pepper.  Taste is fairly herby and spicy but fairly well balanced.  Very light in the palate like most lagers.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours pitch black with a thick tan head.  nose is sharp spices, coffee and banana.  Taste is bittersweet with a small amount of salt in the back.   Sharp and fizzy with a light body however the taste lingers for a long time after the sip.   This was better than expected.  What a treat.

Pours black with beige head.  Aroma of roasted malt, fruit, chocolate, anise. Pleasantly bitter with a smooth, long-lasting finish.  Creamy, full-bodied palate.  Delicious beer.  Would be great with a steak.

Bottle 12 fl.oz from erzbierschof.ch. Beer in fact all black, average beige-brown head. Roasted aromas, chocolate, coffee, licorice, vanilla. The taste is cery malty and rosted grains, burnt and dark bitter chocolate. There is also of the fig, acidity, coffee marc, but creamy and dry. Long finale, earthy by hops and torrefied.

A - Pours a dark brown color with a thick finger of thick frothy chocolate colored head. The head fades down very slowly leaving behind some nice lacing.

S - The aroma is full of lightly roasted chocolate malts, a bit of lactose sweetness, some earthy hop, and just a touch of smoke.

T - Starts off with a mix of roasted chocolate malts and some milk sweetness. There is a bit of earthy hop in the background as well. Through the middle, some bitterness comes through with some earthy bitterness. The finish is a mix of earthy hop, roasted milk chocolate, and a touch of smoke that lingers.

M - Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Feels smooth and just a touch creamy with a roasted and lightly smokey finish.

D - Very drinkable. Very nicely balanced with a nice kick at the finish. Maybe a bit too roasted for the style, but I am really enjoying it.
Aroma is a bit funky, hops and roasted malts. very dark beer with red glow and brown, fading head. Taste is some chocolate, roasted malts, hops and a dryish finish.

Aroma is nutty, roasty, liquorice, some tobacco and more. Impressive.
Flavour is the same with some coffee. Lazy rate, great beer.
Murky brown and a head that keeps up. Some sharp dry hops, lots of liquorish candy. Tasty, funky taste. Very nice. (At the De Molen brewery tasting.)

Bottle at monthly tasting @ De Molen. Black pour, foamy off-white head. Aroma is roasty, slightly fruity, nuts and caramel. Flavor is slightly sweet, somewhat roasty, a hint of bitterness. Nice balance and interesting palate of flavors.

From Voldby, DK.
Bottled, 211211.
Black with beige head. Aroma of coffee. Flavor with notes of chocolate and liqourice.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ - dark black beer with a moderately persistent beige foam; pretty roasted with fair hoppy tones and notes of red fruits; slightly perfumy; full-bodied and fairly tasty, pretty dry and bitter, gently sticky with very long roasted coffeish aftertaste and notes of black cherries - deeply balanced

Rating #665, flaske fra Lagersalget på Grønjordskollegiet  

En sort øl med brunt skær og stort, tæt skum. Aroma er meget porter-agtig med tjære, kaffe, alkohol og lidt chokolade - dog også lidt syrlighed. Ligeledes er smagen meget porter-agtig med en god portion røg, kaffe, alkohol, men dog også syrlighed og gær - den er næsten helt brett-agtig i smagen. Til at starte med en smule alkoholisk, men efter et par tåre en rigtig lækker øl. Jeg troede faktisk at dette var en letdrikkelig porter brygget med brettanomyces. Nok den bedste schwarzbier jeg har smagt. Medium tykkelse og tyngde. Lækker.
Clear very dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is roasted malt and a little coffee. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 181111
From a 33 cl bottle at home.Dark brown beer with a small tanned head. Tar and licorice aroma. Malty, grassy flavor with some hops and sourish/bitter finish. Dark chocolate and coffee notes.
Bottle. Dark amber beer, ok beige head. Chocolate and licorice aroma. Chocolate flavor, dry hoppy, fruity notes. Nicely balanced beer.

Bottle at DØE tasting.
Black with a brown head. Aroma moderate+ malty (chocolate, roasted, burnt) and hoppy (american). Flavor moderate+ sweet and bitter, some acidity from the burnt malt. Light to medium body.
Bottle @ Vinens Verden, Odense. Pours black with a creamy head and lacings. Lovely roasted nose. A bit of fruit, roasted coffee, caramel, grains and ashes. Smooth and mellow. Very tasty!

bottle from stfun. 1/31/11.

colored like a typical porter with an ow head.

the aroma seems fairly hoppy... with notes behind that of nuts, roast, lactose, lactic acid and some cocoa.

the flavor is the same... very toasty and roasty up front but with a metallic cherry skin-like sourness on the end. seems to be the typical shorts beer... infected. this must be killer on tap!

21-OCT-2011, bottle @home, from "Ølbutikken".
Black(!) with lasting beige head.
Citric roasted nose.
Taste is roasted sweet coffee ending citric and a little tart.
Really fresh schwarzbier.

Bottle. Pours deep brown colored with a nice foamy light brown head with a good duration. Aromas of caramel, chocolate, roasted malt and bitter malt. Nice! Flavors of hard roasted malt, bitter, sweet malt and a lasting rich finish. Tasty..

Bottle from Bierkoning. Deep dark brown body with thin head. Nose of chocolate, malts, roast and coffees. Taste is also chocolate, bit more sour and milk chocolate tastes. Nice caramel and toffee in there as well. Gets sweeter and bitter in the finish. Slippery texture. Very nice.

Bottle 33cl. Black beer with tan head with good lacing. Aroma is alcoholic, toasted malts, buttery, bready, black coffee. Flavour is moderate malty, not very hopped, but alcoholic, vinous, wooden. On palate results a beer with medium body, oily feel and average carbonation with a long aftertaste to toasted malts.

Bottle 12fl.oz. @ home.Clear dark brown colour with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, chocolate, light coffee. Flavour is light heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, chocolate malt, dark roasted, coffee. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20110828]

Botella de 330ml servida en vaso Lager.Saboreada en sep´11.Color caoba claro.Espuma beige claro con bastante buena retención que deja algo de encaje.Levaduras,canela y tabaco en nariz con matices de chocolate.Al primer sorbo, sabor a café tostado seguido por sabores de malta muy torrefactada.Paladar con liviano especiado y pimientas. Cuerpo y carbonatación medios.Final de amargo seco y retrogusto igualmente seco con sutiles notas de ahumado y trazos de regaliz.Buena asimilación.330ml bottle served in a Lager glass.Enjoyed on sep´11.Medium mahogany in color.Light beige froth, pretty good retention, some lacing rings.Yeast,cinnamon & tobacco to the nose,hints of chocolate too.Coffee at first sip followed by intense toasted malt flavor.Slightly peppery on palate.Medium body.Medium carbonation.Dry bitter finish & aftertaste with subtle smoky notes & hints of licorice.Good drinkability.

The aroma is sweet and lightly roasted, very typical and right on for the style. The lager pours black rock with a decent dark tan head. The flavor is a crispy dark roasted malty lager with good flavors on a nice body. It ends a bit sweet and very refreshing on the palate.
Bottle. Pours a black color with a small off-white head. Has a roasted malty chocoalte aroma. Roasted malty chooclate flavor with hoppy hints. Has a roasted malty bitter chocolate finish.

Bottle from rayl101.  Black pour with a small beige head, good lace.  Aroma was outstanding.  Incredibly clean mix of dark roast, cocoa and hints of burnt marshmallow.  Flavors were where this one shined though.  Fantastic roasted malt flavors yet it retained a soft, clean palate lending to extreme drinkability.  So refreshing.  This is what the style should strive for.  Top notch.

Botella. Deep dark brown colour, beige small head. Roasty maltiness in the aroma along with chocolate (mild side) and hops. Good soft mouthfeel. Roasty malt, choolate and pleasant bitter hoppiness, bit coffee´like towards the end. Roasty malty pleasant hoppy bitter finish.
Bottle, pours deep dark brown with light brown head... the aroma is vanilla, mocha, sweet.... the flavor is coffee, roasted malt, caramel..... thin body... nice mouthfeel....

Bottle. Pours dark brown with medium beige head. Thanks Faroeviking! The aroma is hard roasted, bitter malt, caramel and is quite rich overall. The flavour is quite bitter and hard roasted with liquorice notes.

12 ounce bottle that poured a dark brown/light black color.  Aroma of mocha, caramel and vanilla.  Taste of chocolate, moalasses, and toffee.    had a moderate roast thoguhout, and not overerly sweet.

Bottle.  Pours black.  Large dark tan head.  Very creamy.  Aroma of coffee and chocolate.  Very roasty flavor with some bitterness.  Palate is relatively thick.    Commercial description is very accurate.  Tons of roast with some chocolate.  Very tasty brew, but dont think I could drink two of this in a sitting even with the relatively low alcohol content

Dark brown with a slowly dissipating rocky brown head that leaves patches of thick lace.  Roasty aroma with chocolate, dark fruit, mild citrus and grains.  Thicker and richer than most Schwarzbiers with a heavy roasted quality.  Some chocolate and coffee notes along with dark fruits
4 oz sample at Churchkey. Dark hazy brown, creamy brown head. Aroma of caramel, cream, chocolate, roast. Taste has sweet chocolate, bitter coffee/cocoa. Medium body and carbonation.

12 fl oz bottle. Pours dark brown to almost black with a deep amber hue and a huge brown head. Aroma is mild fruity, light yeasty and caramelish to roasted dark malty. Light metallic, yeasty, fruity, dark malty flavoured. Bitter, light metallic and lingering fruity into the finish.
Bottle. Very dark brown with medium beige head. Flaovur is roasted malts, chocolate, dry, bitter, hops and fruit.

Bottle, bought @ Skjold Burne, Aarhus.
Deep nut-brown with a fine, staying, frothy, beige head. Dark caramel aroma, some sweet milky chocolate, mild roasted, some fruity hops, some fruity blackberry. Medium carbonation, lovely malty dry and quite creamy palate. Flavour is elegant, mild metallic tartness at first, then fat roasty maltiness, coffee, pine. Long, lingering, seriously dry malty finish. Extremely good for a schwarzbier.
Bottled. A black beer with a lazing brown head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt and soy sauce. The flavor is sweet and acidic from the rosted malt with notes of roasted malt and so sauce.

Bottle at Ølbutikken.
Dark brown coloured with a medium sized beige ehad.
Sweet and light roasted aroma with notes of berries.
Light roasted flavour of berries, grass and hops.
Light roasted finish.

Bottle 35,5 cl. Pours a clear black with a reddish hue and a beige head. Hard roast aroma, slightly tart dark dried fruit. Medium body, hard roast and dark dried fruits  again a slight tartness. Malt bitter finish. 230711
clear broqn, small white head. Sour and tart aroma, almost citrussy, but also sweet dark fruity. Flavor is sweet malty, red fruity, mild.

Bottle. Medium high creamy and lasting light brown head. Very dark red brown body. Almost black. Powerful and lovely roasted malt carame coffeel cocoa aroma. Spicy (coriander like) caramel roasted malt cocoa slightly sour flavor with low carbonation and a long sweet aftertaste. Alcohol level seems just right. Very well balanced.

Bottle shared by BenC - Pours chocolatey brown with a thin tan head. Smells like rye bread and chocolate, lightly toasted. Tastes roughly the same, with a dry, ashy finish. Mixes some dry stout characteristics in there--nice. Thinner body, but it works. Smooth, very nice. Probably my favorite Shorts beer so far!
Bottle at home. Black - offwhite head. Coffee. Sharpness. High malty. Oiley notes. Burned. Light dark chocolate. Light sweet notes. Licorice. Ryebread. Pleasant body and finish.

Bottle.  Pours a dark brown with a thin feel to it as it pours.  A thin film of tan head sits on the surface.  Aromas are weak... a faint whiff of chocolate and earth is about all I pick up.  Flavor is a little more interesting... chocolate and caramel malts play off each other nicely with just a hint of topsoil after a rain or something poetic like that.  It has a kind of creaminess to it (mouthfeel and maybe even a little in the flavor) and ends in a coffee/peat-like bitterness.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text:
On tap at Churchkey. Served in a snifter.

Pours a very dark brown with a single-finger tan head that sticks around for a bit before fading and leaving a bit of light lacing. The nose has a bit of light roast and a bit of dark fruit as well. Mild anise character. The flavor has a moderate amount of roast along with some sweet malt. Dark fruit and cherry come through a bit, along with some slight black licorice. There is a bit of a cardboard character in the finish as it warms, however. Medium body and lightly sweet throughout. Pretty decent.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 06-04-2011

Bottle.  Opaque pour with considerable tan head.  Smell is strongly chocolate and a bit of hazelnut.  Very good beer, silky smooth, goes down easy.   Taste doesnt have the nuttiness I thought it might.

Draft.  Small beige head, dark brown body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, roast, bittersweet chocolate, some smoke, light caramel.  Taste is moderately sweet, bittersweet chocolate, roast, some smoke caramel.  Medium body, some stickiness.

Nice slightly hazy, relatively opaque cola coloured body with a darker brown tint and a thin, fast-dying tan head. Aroma of licorice, concord grapes, permanent marker, a touch meaty and some smoked peat - but not much. Medium-bodied; Assertive roasty flavour with caramel and a touch of earth that fades pretty quickly to the permanent marker flavour, aniseed spicey taste and a little funk and cardboard near the end. Aftertaste shows a good complex finish, but still showing some off tastes like meat, mushrooms and a touch of bitter spices. Overall, an okay schwartz, but nothing great - and to me, way too highly rated. Thats okay considering most of the other Shorts beers Ive had are great - but this one wasnt. I sampled this twelve ounce bottle purchased from the Beer Baron in Livonia, Michigan on 30-April-2011 for US$1.99 sampled at home in Washington on 06-June-2011.

4oz pour at Churchkey.  Pours an opaque black with zero head.  Inviting aroma of biscuit, crackers, malts, toast, light coffee.  Flavor is sweet, toasty, malty, light chocolate, caramel.  Medium bodied, dry finish.  Very drinkable.

Tap at Churchkey for Shorts Tap Takeover. The pour is a clear ruby looking near black. Tan head fades quickly. Nose at first is a giant whiff of Shorts proprietary Mars-derived bacterial infection complete with all of its complexities like blood, vomit, sweat, iron metallic. Taste is luckily not infected so much with astringent coffee and ash coming through. Or maybe the coffee and ash covers the infection. Palate is thin and drained, probably from Shorts alien derived bacteria which I shall from now on refer to as SBC3830-X. Pretty harmless and boring body with a nose that is a play off between nothing and SBC3830-X. It would be interested to have NASA lab SBC3830-X.

Tap at ChurchKey. Pours a dark brown with a thin tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel and chocolate. Taste dominated by roasted malt, with a bit of hops. Rather light body, finishes clean. Refreshing for a darker brew.

At Shorts Brewing Monster Tap Takeover at Churchkey. Poured a dark, almost black color brown, with a small tan head. Aroma was chocolate, roasted malts. Flavor was roasted malts, earthy hops, chocolate malts. Pretty darn good.

Bottle.  Dark brown with an average tan head.  Earthy aroma with chocolate and nuts also present.  The anisette comes out in the flavor, but its subdued by a heavy roasted malt backing with a lingering earthy, soy taste.  Dry texture with good carbonation. Light enough in body to enjoy on a hot day but still has plenty of complexity to make it interesting.
Roasty, toasty, with the characteristics of a very robust porter. Medium bodied. Solid.

Bottle. Deep garnet body, medium to thin tight clumping off-white head. Nose of roasted malts, toast, brown sugar, soy, and leafy hops. The body has a dense flavor profile, with bitter, leafy hops, roasted malts, chocolate, and modest dark sugars that lend sweetness to a mostly bitter beer.  Finishes with leafy, charred hops, soy, and dark fruits. A very good beer.

12 oz bottle.  Pours almost black with a light tan head.  Aroma is strong on aniseed backed by nuts, while some coffee comes in afterwards.  Flavor is again strong aniseed, with some roasty coffee and nuttiness.  Palate is on the cleaner side.  Nice flavors.

12 oz bottle:  Aroma has got a nice roasted malt characteristic and there are some nicely pungent hops backing that up as well.  Nutty, caramel, slightly citrus note from the hops, and a nice chocolate tone as well.  Appearance is almost a opeque black with a medium siuzed tan head that lingers.  Taste is malt forward then melding into a really nice hop chacteristic and then finishes almost clean and clear.  Wow..this thing changes in your mouth three different way.  I really like this for some reason.  It tastes good and is really drinkable.  Complex as well.  Cheers!

I drank from a 12oz bottle into my Orval glass...The beer pours a light black with a ligh tan head, good retention and lacing...The aroma is totally dead, shows off only light chocolate, really boring...The taste is also light, gives a little smoke and chocolate. Usually i want more taste, but for some reason I like this, a light roasty porterish type beer that is really easy to drink. Nothing special here, but if youre in the mood for a roasty dark beer thats easy to drink, not a bad call.
Bottle on 11/12/2010. Clear black body with a small tan head. Sweet roast and molassas aroma. Sweet chocolate, roast and molassas flavor. Medium body with moderate carbonation.

Bottle. Deep brown approaching black body. Frothy brown head, fully diminishing. Roasted malts dominate the nose. Notes of chocolate and toast. The flavor is lightly to moderately sweet and lightly bitter. The finish is lightly sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture turning slick in the finish. Lively carbonation. Taste of roasted malts, vanilla, light black coffee and earthiness. Tart aftertaste with a touch of metal.
Dark brown pour.  Light tan head.  Very roasty aroma with some molasses, licorice, and light coffee.  Flavor is roasty, bitter, dark cherries and some brown sugar.  nice.  Thanks to hellbilly.

Pours deep brown almost black, thin almost tan head.  Aroma has notes of roast, biscuit, burnt toast, and some caramel.  Taste is bitter burnt malt, some biscuit and caramel sweet, and a roasted bitter finish.  Good brew, balanced and tasty.

bottle thanks to Bigmmartin.  Pours a dark brown with a very thin mocha head.  Aroma is roasted malts with notes of coffee and burnt toast.  Palate is very chewy, but a little more carbonated than I expected.  Flavor really brings out a nice roasted maltiness, finishing dry.  Pretty impressive.

bottle thanks to nellie.  poured deep ruby with an off white head.  aroma was chocolate, bourbon, and fudge.  flavor was chocolate, bourbon, and fudge also.  body was slick with low carbonation.  i am not sure why i got bourbon out of this, but i did.

12oz bottle thanks to my friend in MI.  Pours dark brown to black with a small, brown, fading head.  Nose is roasted malts, fresh toasted breads, munich malts, chocolate, light caramel, coffee, and wood.  Taste is breads, cereal, chocolate, nuts, toasted malts.  Starts sweet then finishes bitter and slightly dry from the roast character but is very pleasant with some earthy hop flavor backing.  Full bodied and smooth on the palate.  no lace. no hop aroma.  Good beer.  I could easily mistake it for an American style porter.

12 ounce bottle shared by maniac. Thanks! Pours a clear brown color with a medium frothy head. Decent head retention and lacing. Aroma of roasted malts, nutty notes, toasty notes, caramel and a fruity finish. The taste is bitter hops, nutty notes, lightly roasted malts, faint cherry and citrus. Medium bodied. Nice beer.

12 oz. bottle via trade with manny57 - Pours a dark brown color with a small light tan head.  Very light lacing.  Aroma is sweet toasted malt and spice.  Flavor is lightly roasted malt, light coffee, and spice.  Slight lingering roastiness in the finish.  Medium body.  A good beer.  Thanks Ryan.

12oz bottle from Ryan (Manny57).  Pours a very dark brown, almost black with a minimal amount of head.  Nice lacing.  Some coffee smell and burnt wood.  Some coffee taste, lots of smokey, woody flavor.
Bottle pours the darkest brown you can get before calling it black. Nice aroma of toasted malts. Toasty, nutty, lightly smokey flavor. A medium light body makes this a very drinkable beer.

12oz bottle thanks to Spica66 on BA.  Pours darkest brown with a nice lacey tan head.  The aroma is great - roasty and coffeeish, pretty good.  The flavor is very dry and charcoaly.  Roast and coffee are big.  A little coffee tartness on the finish even.  Medium-bodied and dry with a good carbonation level.  Great schwarzbier overall, very roasty and intense.

(12oz bottle, courtesy of Nellie)  Pours a black body with mahogany edges and thin beige head.  Aroma of roasted malt, vanilla, coffee, molasses, and chocolate.  Flavor of roasted malt, cocoa, light smoke, toasted grain, and nuts with a dry, bitter finish.

Purchased from Serrafinos in Richland, Mich.  Poured from a 12-ounce bottle into a pint glass.  This is an "apples n oranges" kindve beer and to my untrained palate, somewhat conflicting.  Never the less, its not too bad and I would certainly put back another.

Thanks to Nellie for sharing this bottle.

The beer pours a dark brown color with red highlights and a white head. The aroma is roasted malt, coffee, burnt malt, dark fruit and smoke. The flavor is heavy on the smoke and roasted malt along with some caramel malt and dark fruit notes in the background. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

(12oz bottle thanks to Nellie) opaque deep brown with a ring of tan bubbles. Nose of brown sugar, coffee with cream and nuts. Taste of roasty sweet nuts, cream, mild smoke, and raisins with a creamy finish. Nice schwarzbier!
Bottle shared by thirdeye11.  Black pour.  Aroma is rich roasted coffee.  Taste is coffee, caramel and slightly creamy.  Smooth finish, with some warmth.  Good stuff.
bottle, thanks to thirdeye11, walnut colored pour with nutty roast aromas, flavors is thin, pecan shells, roast nuts
Thin beer, but black.  Caramel and brown sugar.  If i was to compare this to Xingu, Id pick Xingu.

bottle thanks to thirdeye11.  poured a deep brown almost black with ruby highlights.  nose is roasted malts, licorice, vanilla, and slight chocolate.  smooth on the palate, flavor is roasted malts, chocolate, vanilla, and a great finish.
Bottle thanks to wnoble. Pours black with creamy tan mocha head. Nose is licorice, chocolate and breads. Mouth feel is bready. Taste is chocolate malts and licorice.

Draft. Dark brown/black pour with a tan head. Good alce left on the glass. Smooth taste. Coffee notes both in the taste and the aroma. Slight bitterness. Medium mouthfeel. Tasty but not something I woul search out for myself.

Very dark brown pour with off white head.   Nose is dark roasted caramely malt.   Molasses, brown sugar, vanilla, and roasted notes throughout...some light and crisp lager notes.  Very refreshing and repeatable...Im impressed.

Bottled.  Poured deep brown with a spotty cap of medium brown.  The aroma reeked of deliciousness.. warm chocolates and molasses surrounded by sweeter mocha, vanilla, and a touch of caramel.. moderate roast throughout.. perfectly balanced.  The flavor found more of the molasses and mocha at the semi-sweet, lightly-burnt core.. sweet milky chocolates, vanilla, and a touch of earthy husk around.. finished on the sweet side with a lovely complement of dry-roasted coffee bitterness.  Medium-bodied at most, dry, and well-balanced on the palate.. this was one of the easiest-drinkin beers Ive had in a while, and it somehow maintained tubs of character too!  Id love to have this on tap in the basement (seriously.. anybody with a hook-up, please let me know!).

Draft at Graydons Crossing (Grand Rapids, MI). Pours a near blackish pour, dark brown edges with a decent tannish head, almost chocolate milk with with decent film, laces ok. Aromas are black licorice, light roastiness, touch of sweet toffee malts, light creaminess. Initial is lighter bodied, a dash of dark licorice, light sweetness, very nice on the palate. A pleasant light black licorice, touch of caramel and creamy sweetness. Light floral hopping, very smoothed out and sessionable. Licorice lingers on the palate. A tasty flavorful schwarz with that extra licorice kick and roasty malts with sweeter cocoa. Tasty

Sampled at Schlaflys 2010 Repeal of Prohibition Festival - Really nice Schwarzbier.  Pours very dark with a tan soapy headd.  The aroma has sweet licorice, chocolate, dark malt (no bitterness), vanilla and cream.  Medium clean body with fairly light carbonation.  The flavor starts with dry cocoa, very nice roasty malt with good bitterness and a bit of spice.  The finish is spicy and bitter.  Great beer.

12oz bottle from my Secret Santa - thanks, deyholla! Nice to try this, having had the barrel-aged version a couple times. Nice frothing dark brown pour, with a nose thats far more chocolatey than roasty. Certainly more sweetness turns up in the flavor too, with the nice caramel flavors coming out nicely. But the roasted goodness of the schwarz is in there too, and its a lively and refreshing take on the style.

Bottle. A black color pour with a small off white head, medium carbonation , spotty and jagged lacing . Aroma is caramel and roasty grain , coffee ,black licorice, and spicy hops . Flavor is very roasty , lightly sweet , lightly bitter with some roasty malt,caramel, black licorice, and earthy spicy hops . medium body , smooth creamy mouthfeel , very sessionable and very good , Nice work Shorts .

On tap at Shorts.  Pours black with a small light tan head.  Aroma of lots of roasted malt and grains, creamy bitter chocolate, and a hint of lactose.  Flavor of toffee, lots of bitter chocolate, roasted malts.  A light mouthfeel with a creamy texture.  Very nice and quite a tasty schwarzbier.
7/4/8/4/15 [3.8/5]

Pours mahogany with micro thin off white head. The aroma is pleasing with dark fruit, black licorice, dark roasted malts and a bit of burnt malts. The taste seems to begin with a thin layer of astringent like tartness with dark to burnt malts, sweet black licorice, earthy and a sense of yeastiness filling in toward the finish.

12 oz. bottle - deyholla hooking it up; pours clear dark cola brown; 1" foamy tan head fading quickly to thin film; caramel, licorice, dry chocolate and ashy malt on the nose; light, crisp mouthfeel with a dry sweetness and light roast; chocolate and dry malt with sticky dry finish and lingering licorice sweetness; easy to drink with crisp, clean flavor profile
Thanks to Northernbrews.  Aroma of coffee, chocolate and strong roast.  Flavor is more of that strong roast and cocoa.  Almost reminds me more of a brown ale than a black beer.  Very good and roasty.

Thanks Jdubfl for the share.
Pours dark brown with thin tan head. 
Aroma and flavors,  dark chocolate and roasted malts, hints of coffee with a lingering dark fruit bitterness coupled with some grains.

Thanks to the Tampa Crew for sharing.  Pours brown with a tan head.  Nose is roast, spice, chocolate, licorice, a hint of smoke, and dark stuff.  Flavor is some dry roasted coffee along with the flavors in the aroma.  Light to medium body and very surprising for a Schwarz.

This Shorts beer has a black-brown pour (it is a dark ruby when held up to a light) with a one to two finger tan head that recedes to a broken cover and ring after a few minutes, and left some lacing on the glass as I drank, 

there were aromas of dark caramel, dark toast, dry chocolate, roasted malt, licorice and a dark honey sweetness with a little vanilla, 

the beer had flavors of dark bread, licorice, some roasted malt sweetness and little notes of dry bitter chocolate, 
finish has barely a bite to it but there is a little bitterness, licorice and earthy mint run along on the palate after each drink, 

has a medium mouth feel, 

I thought this beer had more licorice and sweetness than the other Schwarzbiers I had tried, I do not mind a little licorice but more than that is too much for me, so, my rating will reflect how much I enjoyed this beer, its not the beer, it is me, if you like licorice, you will more than likely prefer this beer more than I.

Black pour with a loose tan head.  Lots of deeply roasted malt, with hints of licorice, tobacco, and coffee.  The flavor follows through from the aroma but with a more pronounced licorice note, some spicy hops on the finish with a clean lager crispness and a lasting bitterness.  Oily medium body with moderate carbonation.
12oz bottle as an extra from Attitude Brew.  Pours deep cola brown with a nice frothy beige head, decent lacing.  Nice roasted malts and toffee with faint herbal hop notes.

Another awesome beer shared by Timbo! Pours a pure black color with a large brown head. The aroma is sweet chocolates, some hops for sure, caramel and toasted malts. The flavor is a really well-made Schwarzbier; chocolates, rich earthy malts, caramel, very flavorful. I could drink a ton of these.

out of the white-labeled and white-capped bottle comes a black beer, not stout opaque but certainly porter black.  tiny barely mentionable beige head circles atop, and clean caramel and burnt sugars float around in the aroma with classic schwarz lager yeast. molasses and slightly green balanced finish; neither cloying nor dry and no perceptible alcohol heat. an uncommon style to take to market, but its sweet and clean enough to appeal. pricier at $11 a sixer, but an enjoyable beer nonetheless.

Bottle. Pours black with a small light brown head. Aroma has notes of dark grains with some roast and a bit of caramel. Flavor is full of dark grains and caramel with a bit of a roasted kick towards the finish.

A pretty average beer to me.  One of my favorite style,s but this one just has all of the typical features of the style without anythin being wonderful.  Slight head, nice dark color, a static, carmel malt profile without much depth.

This poured a black as night color with a beige head. Aroma was grassy hops, some lightly toasted malt, and some other things. Flavor was light bodied toasted malts, very light chocolate, and light german grassy hops. Typical Schwartz but nothing special.
Pretty black color is this beers only claim to fame. Bland!!! No tastes or aromas that are worth describing. No hops anywhere. Thin body and head.

Very dark brown pour -- almost black.  Very subtle tan head.  Aroma of chocolate, licorice, light roast.  Some dark fruits.  Flavor of licorice, dark chocolate, oreos.  I detect a bit of creaminess which makes this taste like an ice cream sandwich.  Really delicious.  Full mouthfeel, thick texture, nice carbonation.  Finishes with chocolate wafers.  Easily my fav schwarz ever.

Bottle. Best schwartzbier Ive had. Porteresque. Black pour with beige head. no infection here. Was worried considering all their problems as of late. Aroma of roasted coffee, chocolate, grass. Rich flavor. Bitter, dry chocolate. Coffee, roasted malt. Like a Porter or dry stout. Nicely done

Sampled at Schlafly Repeal.  Enjoyed with Vyvvy and Terminus.  A very nice black lager with some fun stuff going on.  Gobs of roasted accents reign supreme.  A bit of smoke.  A great looking beer and one that has some ornery attitude to it.  Very enjoyable and a fun beer to sample.

tap at repeal prohibition festival at Schalfly in Maplewood, MO.  probably my favorate beer of the festival for sure!  pours deep brown/mahogony hue in the light with a soapy beige head.  very nice looking beer!  chocolate, nuts (almonds) with a hint of vanilla and roast on the nose. flavors of dark chocolate dominate along with roast, char, and nutty notes.  slightly chalky feel on the palate, but that didnt detract-pretty common for this style.  Very nise for the style-better than Black Bavarian and reminds me alot of Rio Salados version way back when it was around.  i dig it!

Tasted 4/17/10.  Schlaflys Repeal of Prohibition Festival.  Dark with an opaque hue.  Great dark roasted malts with an almost burnt quality, which I loved!  All malts in the palate.  But very full, rich and delicious.  The roasty aspect lingers in the finish.  Very full and complex with a great flavor and mouthfeel.  This was my favorite of the festival!  Wonderfully done!

On draft, Schlafly Beer Fest.  Was at first quite skeptical when I saw "dark" and "spring seasonal" in the description.  One smell and one taste later, I am all over this great beer.  Like the "Hangin Frank" this shows the skills of the Shorts brewers.  Roasty, licorice, coffee, all the things youd say about a great stout BUT much lighter in body while still weighing in at 5.7%.  If I lived in Northern Michigan, this would be in my regular Spring lineup.  Excellent!

Without hesitation, I can assure you, this is the greatest beer I have ever had. It is dark and rich and contains a mysterious richness without falling into a bitter finish. If youre into creamy, dark beer, you must try Sustenance.
(draught at Schlafly Repeal of Prohibition) black with tan head. Roast malt aroma Flavor is roast malt, hints of coffee, but the lighter body of a lager than a stout.

Almost black in color. Shared at the CL Flaming Fury release.  Some light chocolate, roast, and some sour cherry in the aroma, with touches of funk.  Taste has some roast, light chocolate, and sour cherry, funky - and brett.

5oz sample at brewery 7/2/09-Pours a light black with ruby tints with a small tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, and chocolate. Taste of the same with more coffee and chocolate. This light to medium bodied beer was nice tasting and very smooth.
UPDATED: JUL 14, 2009 Pours opaque brown/black with a tan head. Scents of lightly roasted malt. Roast coffee, chocolate, toffee flavor, with a med-dry finish.

Draft at MBGF Summer08. Poured  cloudy black color with medium brown creamy head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Medium to heavy roasted coffee and sweet malt aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture. Medium to heavy flavor of toasted sweet malt with a medium bittersweet finish of moderate to long duration. Interesting solid brew.

2008 MiBGF: Very deep brown, nearly black with a very good creamy head. The aroma has notes of prune, walnut, grassy hops, slight smoke and roast, minty and yeasty. The taste has a nice malty, fruity, and herbal balance. Slightly nutty and bready upon the finish. The mouth feel is smooth and quite drinkable. Mikey Likey this brew.
